pullRequest.body:
We also introduce the notation `∗o` for `Ordinal.toNimber o`. Note that for `n : ℕ`, `∗n` is **not** the same as `NatCast`, as e.g. `∗2 ≠ ↑2 = 0`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [89a0a2783d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16878/commits/89a0a2783d4eb667afedafcf4a2b9587aea431d2)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.SetTheory.Ordinal.Nimber | 619 | 621 | +2 (+0.32%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.SetTheory.Ordinal.Nimber`|2|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ add_nat`
`+ eq_nat_of_le_nat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

> Note that for n : ℕ, ∗n is not the same as NatCast, as e.g. ∗2 ≠ ↑2 = 0.

This should definitely be recorded in a docstring in this file - maybe with a comment that the axioms for `AddMonoidWithOne` are not satisfied with `natCast n := ∗n`.

Is the prefix-asterisk notation standard for this embedding?

The notation is standard, it's introduced in page 121 of Conway's "On Numbers And Games".

I'll add the docstring in a few hours when I get back home.

> The notation is standard, it's introduced in page 121 of Conway's "On Numbers And Games".

Alright, I'd like if this were recorded in the file too. A reference to this book from mathlib would surely be sensible regardless!
The reference already exists! I've added it to the docstring.
bors d+

:v: vihdzp can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11273504204/job/31350665436)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11273504204/job/31350665902)
Is it possible to deduce this from `grundyValue_nim_add_nim`, or maybe the other way around?
We should be doing this the other way around. I plan to redefine `grundyValue` as a nimber in the near future, and to prove the more general result `grundyValue (nim a + nim b) = ∗a + ∗b`.
I agree this is a good way round - do you want to add a TODO in this file saying to define grundyValue as a nimber?
That TODO already exists right above `grundyValue_nim_add_nim`, actually :).
Great!

```suggestion
## Notations

We also define notation `∗o` for `Ordinal.toNimber o` in the `Nimber` namespace. Note that for
```
and the notation section should go above the implementation notes section (https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html).

```suggestion
theorem toNimber_toOrdinal (a : Ordinal) : Nimber.toOrdinal (∗a) = a :=
```
You use this pattern twice - maybe it should be a lemma? If an ordinal is <= a natural, then it's equal to a natural.
I've added `eq_nat_of_le_nat`, it does simplify the proof a bit.

```suggestion
      rw [add_nat]
      simpa using hc.ne
```
a golf, if you like.
really nice!

```suggestion
    · apply h.ne
      simpa [Nat.xor_comm, Nat.xor_cancel_left, ← hc'] using add_nat (c ^^^ b) b
    · apply h.ne
      simpa [Nat.xor_comm, Nat.xor_cancel_left, ← hc'] using add_nat a (c ^^^ a)
```
a golf, if you like

```suggestion
```
Lean figures this one out!

```suggestion
      rw [OrderIso.lt_iff_lt, Nat.cast_lt] at hc
```
seems surely better (you might need a \l on the second one, I didn't check)
For whatever reason, the termination checker fails when doing this. I'm not really sure what's going on there.
Ah, probably the old version is kept around secretly somewhere, and the termination checker is using that as proof of termination

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SetTheory/Ordinal/Nimber): nim addition of natural numbers is XOR
